Affirmed.
JUSTICE STAMOS delivered the opinion of the court:
On August 21, 1984, the dismembered body of Danny Bridges was found in eight garbage bags in a dumpster in Chicago. Following a jury trial in the circuit court of Cook County, the defendant, Larry Eyler, was convicted of murder, kidnapping, aggravated kidnapping, unlawful restraint, and concealment of a homicidal death (Ill. Rev. *181 Stat. 1983, ch. 38, pars. 9-1(a)(1), 10-1(a)(3), 10-2(a)(3), 10-3(a), 9-3.1(a)).
The State requested a death penalty hearing; defendant waived a jury for that hearing. The trial court, finding no mitigating factors sufficient to preclude imposition of the death penalty, imposed the sentence of death.
